text_logic_form: A line is tangent to a circle.
diagram_logic_form: The length of the line $BC$ is $4$ units.
The length of the line $CD$ is $2$ units.
The length of the line $BE$ is $3$ units.
The length of the line $AE$ is $x$ units.
Point $E$ lies on the line connecting $A$ and $B$.
Point $C$ lies on the line connecting $B$ and $D$.
Point $A$ lies on the circumference of the circle with center $X$ and radius $4$ units.
Point $C$ lies on the circumference of the circle with center $X$ and radius $4$ units.
Point $D$ lies on the circumference of the circle with center $X$ and radius $4$ units.
Point $E$ lies on the circumference of the circle with center $X$ and radius $4$ units.
circle_instances: There is a circle with center at point $X$.
